item.title: Blocked road - no works going on, 24th July
item.description:
79 Long Acre. There were no works done in the last two years - I'm cycling past this place every day and nothing's been done. The street is narrow with a contra-flow cycle lane, so cars, vans and trucks have to block the cycle lane when passing these works, endangering the lives of cyclists. This was supposed to be removed in April 2025

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Long Acre, Bloomsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No zig zags at puffin crossing, 24th July
item.description:
PLEASE NOTE I reported this issue earlier today but was told a TfL issue. TfL have said it is a Westminster issue. The puffin crossing is not on a red route. Streetcare New updates on Coaches parked and blocking traffic lights Thank you for taking the time to report this to us. It is much appreciated. Our team had investigated this for you and found that this doesn't fall under the responsibility of Transport for London and comes under the remit of the local authority. You may therefore wish to report this issue by using www.fixmystreet.com, or directly to the borough. Should you need anything else, please contact our customer services team on 0343 222 1234 State changed to: not TfLâ€™s responsibility TfL Unsubscribe from alerts about this report Coaches parked and blocking traffic lights I have attached a photo of the puffin crossing on the Haymarket just after St James Market. As you can see there are coached parked on both sides of the street. These coaches were completely blocking the traffic lights for the crossing. Vehicles driving down the Haymarket were not aware a crossing was there. I saw a number of cars go through the crossing on the red light narrowly avoiding pedestrians who were crossing when the green man was showing. I went and spoke to one of the drivers and he moved his coach further down the road. In such a busy area this crossing should be protected by zig zags. The photo was taken at 1230 today the 23 July on the Haymarket at the corner of St James Market and should be visible on CCTV.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Norris Street, Bloomsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet
